column4: Hello! I created a new user using System -> Administration -> Users and Groups -> Add user -> Inserting username and password -> OK. How to make this users a 'limited account' (In Windows XP) who can edit, view files but not install programs, using sudo.. etc
that's the beauty of it - user accounts are limited accounts by default
the *only* administrator account will ever be root
http://paste.ubuntu.com/31326/
looking
grep 127.0.1.1 /etc/hosts
127.0.1.1 osama-laptop
you didn't change your hostname correctly. edit /etc/hosts and change 127.0.1.1 osama-laptop to  127.0.1.1 osama-toshiba-laptop
I just created a new user using GUI windows, what should I do else?
login as the user and see if they can sudo
I do can, check former link
osama2@osama-toshiba-laptop:~$ sudo apt-get install wine -> works
yes, and i told you how to fix it
edit /etc/hosts and change 127.0.1.1 osama-laptop to  127.0.1.1 osama-toshiba-laptop this is a command?
no, i figured you knew how to do that - okay, sudo gedit /etc/hosts
Would that make any problems with my original account?
no, it should fix any that you may currently have
OK, replaced, but sudo is still working. Should I log-out first?
couldn't hurt
